metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11502 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
snap-confine in snapd before 2.38 incorrectly set the ownership of a snapapplication to the uid and gid of the first calling user. Consequently,that user had unintended access to a private /tmp directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.38
snapd - 2.38
snapd-xdg-open - 2.38
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.38
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.38
ubuntu-snappy - 2.38
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.38
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38').
